page.title: 13INFORMATION SYSTEMS RAFFORD
page.content: Out of the 41 houses we covered in the Rafford area we found that the most popular computer was the Spectrum 48k with 7.Secondly was the Commodore 64 with 3.Then the Vic 20 with 2 and the BBC,Apple,Sharp and the ZX81 all got 1.6 people could write there own programs and between them they have written 30 games.Nobody had a disk drive.All 16 people had a cassette recorder.6 people had a joystick(and interface)two people had a printer and 2 people had a built in monitor.In Rafford a mobile library comes round to some areas.It either comes weekly or fortnightly .The van comes to only 18 houses out of 41.16 more people prefer to use Forres library than the mobile library.The voters roll of the area is kept in the community centre, while information on buildings is kept at the Forres Archives.
